job_title: Revenue Cycle Manager in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: The sisters do seem to really be interested in living out the mission..... but, people in charge including HR are not what I would consider transparent or ethical.
cons: HR cannot be trusted at all. During the past 2 rounds of layoffs, HR and management were compiling lists of people who used FMLA and workers comp to go to the top of the list. Front line staff didn't know about this, and it's illegal to do this. Don't trust HR or your manager. Keep in mind, this review is coming from a former manager.

review_title: Avera is a great organization to be a part of!
job_title: Systems Analyst in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: The people are amazing and no matter what your position in the organization you can see how your work impacts the patients care. Overall, Avera works hard to be competitive compensation by doing ongoing market analysis per job. I think the work life balance is definitely promoted by all department managers and administration. I think the great thing about Avera is the on going 1 on 1 sessions that are mandatory once to twice per month. Management and administration takes pride in keeping the communication open with  all its' employees.
cons: No matter where you work there is always cons. I definitely think they could work on helping employees with their career goals and show them how and what opportunities they should take to fulfill those goals.

job_title: in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Job security. Pay is average. Co-workers are great to work with. Recently changed PTO policy to help employees have more pad time off.
cons: Changing work place policy has provided a micro-management culture. Every movement is monitored. Management creates a work environment where character assassination is viewed as a positive career move. Healthy activities are viewed as potential actionable write ups. Nepotism is an everyday reality. Equipment that helps maintain a healthy body is denied when requested. Not a family friendly environment. Colleagues have had situations where daycare closed or a child was sick and then were publicly shamed for it.

review_title: Poor wages/ High patient loads/ hard to get vacation
job_title: BSN-RN in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Some of the nurses do care about their patients. If you are a brand new nurse with no experience, it is easy to get a job.
cons: Very high turnover rate (assuming from burnout). Too many brand new nurses in critical areas (Avera seems to thrive on new nurses and doesn't seem to seek experienced nurses). Hard to get vacation and must be put in 6 months in advance (many staff carry up 300 hours of PTO). High patient to nurse ratio/ Avera gave key staff members (nurses) a pay cut after a bad quarter/ Avera recently had to pay back wages to nursing staff after violation of breaks. Poor management that has not been properly trained. VERY POOR WORK/LIFE BALANCE. Wages are low (after seven years I left Avera, starting wage at new job "not avera" was over $2.00 more an hour.) Very clicky, back biting atmosphere with management being part of the environment.

job_title: Staff RN in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: The hospital management is truly supportive. There are many opportunities to expand skill levels and for advancement. Have never worked with a kinder, more genuine, and hard working supervisory team. The hospital was beautiful, the food outstanding, and the patient rooms and common areas were inviting and conducive to a therapeutic milieu.
cons: The pay was lower than competitors, but working conditions made it well worth the difference. Unfortunately, there were a few jealous, gossipy RNs who tried to undermine promising new hires. Watched it happen to others, and it was the one reason I was glad to leave for travel nursing.

job_title: Radiation Oncologist in Aberdeen, SD
pros:
Pay on the lower end of average but livable.
Very caring staff and coworkers.
Buildings are newer or being remodeled.
cons:
Leadership changes the "truth" based on their audience.
CEO uses religion to keep his flock in line but everyone knows that he can't be trusted.
Avera expects all employees to be loyal but offers no loyalty in return.

job_title: Network Analyst III in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Compensation is good for this area. People are friendly and professional. Manager's are focused on making employees happy. Family friendly work environment. Plenty of overtime and extra pay opportunities.
cons: PTO is confusing. Have 21 total days to begin, however 6 of those days are for holidays. Which actually only leaves 3 weeks. Job Description are not inline with actual work functions. Some positions hire under qualified people for there actual functions, which creates a revolving door.

review_title: It's like working at your own home
job_title: Staff RN in Gregory, SD
pros: If you like working as if you are not working at all because of the people that you work with, than work at Avera. Where you can find accommodating and accepting colleagues and workmates.
cons: I really cannot think of any right now. Maybe if there is one it might be the fear of losing someone because we take care of very old people which we tend to treat as family because of long term care.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Aberdeen, SD

Education and experience level aren't considered with certain positions, and compensation.

job_title: Patient Care Partner in Sioux Falls, SD

I would recommend this hospital to everyone, whether it's someone looking for a job or someone needing medical attention.
cons: I have no cons. I thoroughly enjoyed my job.
